metadata.title: CVE-2021-47245 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:netfilter: synproxy: Fix out of bounds when parsing TCP options The TCPoption parser in synproxy (synproxy_parse_options) could read one byte outof bounds. When the length is 1, the execution flow gets into the loop,reads one byte of the opcode, and if the opcode is neither TCPOPT_EOL norTCPOPT_NOP, it reads one more byte, which exceeds the length of 1. This fixis inspired by commit 9609dad263f8 ("ipv4: tcp_input: fix stack out ofbounds when parsing TCP options."). v2 changes: Added an early return whenlength < 0 to avoid calling skb_header_pointer with negative length.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47245` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-1069-fips - 4.15.0-1069.78
linux-image-hmac-4.15.0-1069-fips - 4.15.0-1069.78
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1069-fips - 4.15.0-1069.78
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-1069-fips - 4.15.0-1069.78
